intro: Nimmoia lawii, commonly known as the Law's ghost orchid, is a rare and elusive flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of northern Queensland, Australia. It is a terrestrial orchid that thrives in shaded, moist environments with rich, organic soil. The plant produces delicate, pale greenish-white flowers with intricate patterns that resemble ghostly shapes, contributing to its common name. Nimmoia lawii is known for its unique morphology, featuring a slender, erect stem and a single, elongated leaf. Due to its habitat specificity and limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species facing threats from habitat destruction and climate change.
